trans-unit.source: The NsSample sample program

seg-source.mrk: The NsSample sample program

target.mrk: The NsSample sample program

trans-unit.source: The <codeph>NsSample</codeph> demonstration program is a simple JDBC application that interacts with the Network Server.

seg-source.mrk: The <codeph>NsSample</codeph> demonstration program is a simple JDBC application that interacts with the Network Server.

target.mrk: The <codeph>NsSample</codeph> demonstration program is a simple JDBC application that interacts with the Network Server.

trans-unit.source: Network Server

seg-source.mrk: Network Server

target.mrk: Network Server

trans-unit.source: NsSample sample program

seg-source.mrk: NsSample sample program

target.mrk: NsSample sample program

trans-unit.source: The <codeph>NsSample</codeph> program performs the following tasks:

seg-source.mrk: The <codeph>NsSample</codeph> program performs the following tasks:

target.mrk: The <codeph>NsSample</codeph> program performs the following tasks:

trans-unit.source: Starts the Network Server.

seg-source.mrk: Starts the Network Server.

target.mrk: Starts the Network Server.

trans-unit.source: Checks that the Network Server is running.

seg-source.mrk: Checks that the Network Server is running.

target.mrk: Checks that the Network Server is running.

trans-unit.source: Loads the Network Client driver. (Note that this step is not necessary if you are running the client on JDK 1.6 or higher. In that environment, the network client driver loads automatically.)

seg-source.mrk: Loads the Network Client driver.
(Note that this step is not necessary if you are running the client on JDK 1.6 or higher.
In that environment, the network client driver loads automatically.)

target.mrk: Loads the Network Client driver.
(Note that this step is not necessary if you are running the client on JDK 1.6 or higher.
In that environment, the network client driver loads automatically.)

trans-unit.source: Creates the <codeph>NsSampledb</codeph> database if it has not already been created.

seg-source.mrk: Creates the <codeph>NsSampledb</codeph> database if it has not already been created.

target.mrk: Creates the <codeph>NsSampledb</codeph> database if it has not already been created.

trans-unit.source: Checks to see if the schema is already created, and if not, creates the schema, which includes the SAMPLETBL table and corresponding indexes.

seg-source.mrk: Checks to see if the schema is already created, and if not, creates the schema, which includes the SAMPLETBL table and corresponding indexes.

target.mrk: Checks to see if the schema is already created, and if not, creates the schema, which includes the SAMPLETBL table and corresponding indexes.

trans-unit.source: Connects to the database.

seg-source.mrk: Connects to the database.

target.mrk: Connects to the database.

trans-unit.source: Loads the schema by inserting data.

seg-source.mrk: Loads the schema by inserting data.

target.mrk: Loads the schema by inserting data.

trans-unit.source: Starts client threads to perform database related operations.

seg-source.mrk: Starts client threads to perform database related operations.

target.mrk: Starts client threads to perform database related operations.

trans-unit.source: Has each of the clients perform DML operations (select, insert, delete, update) using JDBC calls. For example, one client thread establishes an embedded connection to perform database operations, while another client thread establishes a client connection to the Network Server to perform database operations.

seg-source.mrk: Has each of the clients perform DML operations (select, insert, delete, update) using JDBC calls.

For example, one client thread establishes an embedded connection to perform database operations, while another client thread establishes a client connection to the Network Server to perform database operations.

target.mrk: Has each of the clients perform DML operations (select, insert, delete, update) using JDBC calls.

For example, one client thread establishes an embedded connection to perform database operations, while another client thread establishes a client connection to the Network Server to perform database operations.

trans-unit.source: Waits for the client threads to finish the tasks.

seg-source.mrk: Waits for the client threads to finish the tasks.

target.mrk: Waits for the client threads to finish the tasks.

trans-unit.source: Shuts down the Network Server at the end of the demonstration.

seg-source.mrk: Shuts down the Network Server at the end of the demonstration.

target.mrk: Shuts down the Network Server at the end of the demonstration.

trans-unit.source: You must install the following files in the <codeph>%<ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productinstallpath"></ph>%\demo\nserverdemo\</codeph> directory before you can run the sample program:

seg-source.mrk: You must install the following files in the <codeph>%<ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productinstallpath"></ph>%\demo\nserverdemo\</codeph> directory before you can run the sample program:

target.mrk: You must install the following files in the <codeph>%<ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productinstallpath"></ph>%\demo\nserverdemo\</codeph> directory before you can run the sample program:

trans-unit.source: <codeph>NsSample.java</codeph>

seg-source.mrk: <codeph>NsSample.java</codeph>

target.mrk: <codeph>NsSample.java</codeph>

trans-unit.source: This is the entry point into the sample program. The program starts up two client threads. The first client establishes an embedded connection to perform database operations, and the second client establishes a client connection to the Network Server to perform database operations.

seg-source.mrk: This is the entry point into the sample program.
The program starts up two client threads.
The first client establishes an embedded connection to perform database operations, and the second client establishes a client connection to the Network Server to perform database operations.

target.mrk: This is the entry point into the sample program.
The program starts up two client threads.
The first client establishes an embedded connection to perform database operations, and the second client establishes a client connection to the Network Server to perform database operations.

trans-unit.source: You can change the following constants to modify the sample program:

seg-source.mrk: You can change the following constants to modify the sample program:

target.mrk: You can change the following constants to modify the sample program:

trans-unit.source: NUM_ROWS

seg-source.mrk: NUM_ROWS

target.mrk: NUM_ROWS

trans-unit.source: The number of rows that must be initially loaded into the schema.

seg-source.mrk: The number of rows that must be initially loaded into the schema.

target.mrk: The number of rows that must be initially loaded into the schema.

trans-unit.source: ITERATIONS

seg-source.mrk: ITERATIONS

target.mrk: ITERATIONS

trans-unit.source: The number of iterations for which each client thread does database related work.

seg-source.mrk: The number of iterations for which each client thread does database related work.

target.mrk: The number of iterations for which each client thread does database related work.

trans-unit.source: NUM_CLIENT_THREADS

seg-source.mrk: NUM_CLIENT_THREADS

target.mrk: NUM_CLIENT_THREADS

trans-unit.source: The number of clients that you want to run the program against.

seg-source.mrk: The number of clients that you want to run the program against.

target.mrk: The number of clients that you want to run the program against.

trans-unit.source: NETWORKSERVER_PORT

seg-source.mrk: NETWORKSERVER_PORT

target.mrk: NETWORKSERVER_PORT

trans-unit.source: The port on which the Network Server is running.

seg-source.mrk: The port on which the Network Server is running.

target.mrk: The port on which the Network Server is running.

trans-unit.source: <codeph>NsSampleClientThread.java</codeph>

seg-source.mrk: <codeph>NsSampleClientThread.java</codeph>

target.mrk: <codeph>NsSampleClientThread.java</codeph>

trans-unit.source: This file contains two Java classes:

seg-source.mrk: This file contains two Java classes:

target.mrk: This file contains two Java classes:

trans-unit.source: The <codeph>NsSampleClientThread</codeph> class extends <codeph>Thread</codeph> and instantiates a <codeph>NsSampleWork</codeph> instance.

seg-source.mrk: The <codeph>NsSampleClientThread</codeph> class extends <codeph>Thread</codeph> and instantiates a <codeph>NsSampleWork</codeph> instance.

target.mrk: The <codeph>NsSampleClientThread</codeph> class extends <codeph>Thread</codeph> and instantiates a <codeph>NsSampleWork</codeph> instance.

trans-unit.source: The <codeph>NsSampleWork</codeph> class contains everything that is required to perform DML operations using JDBC calls. The <codeph>doWork</codeph> method in the <codeph>NsSampleWork</codeph> class represents all the work done as part of this sample program.

seg-source.mrk: The <codeph>NsSampleWork</codeph> class contains everything that is required to perform DML operations using JDBC calls.
The <codeph>doWork</codeph> method in the <codeph>NsSampleWork</codeph> class represents all the work done as part of this sample program.

target.mrk: The <codeph>NsSampleWork</codeph> class contains everything that is required to perform DML operations using JDBC calls.
The <codeph>doWork</codeph> method in the <codeph>NsSampleWork</codeph> class represents all the work done as part of this sample program.

trans-unit.source: This file contains helper methods to start the Network Server and to shut down the server.

target.mrk: This file contains helper methods to start the Network Server and to shut down the server.
